greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: For n <= 4, a(n) = n, for n > 4, if n is prime, a(n) = 3 + 2*A000035(A000720(n)), otherwise a(n) = 3 + n - A000720(n).
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of function f defined as: f(n) = A071986(n) when n is an odd prime, otherwise f(n) = -n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: For n <= 4, a(n) = n, for n > 4, if n is prime, a(n) = 3 + 2*A000035(A000720(n)), otherwise a(n) = 3 + n - A000720(n).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 18 2020
